feed.title: prthamesh’s blog
feed.subtitle: Collection of random stuff that I learn through building and fixing software

entry.title: DataViz Dashboards using Python, the Resources

link.title: DataViz Dashboards using Python, the Resources

entry.summary: All the Data Science enthusiasts would agree on the fact that: Data Visualization using Python is hard!. We’ll look at some means via which we can do data visualization & dashboards.

entry.title: Machine Learning Resources for Python [Basic]
entry.summary: There are lots of github repositories and blogs that have more exhaustive resources than what I’ve put down here that covers a whole lot. But these would be good to start off, I’ll put together an intermediate list in the next post.

entry.title: Understanding OpenCV - Code Snippets
entry.summary: I made a jump directly to Computer Vision by using Deep Learning, mostly using CNNs & Keras. CNN & Keras are like Adam West’s Batman & Burt Ward’s Robin, much simpler & fun days of the bat vigilante.

entry.title: Pandas Indexing & Selecting using iloc, loc and ix

link.title: Pandas Indexing & Selecting using iloc, loc and ix

entry.summary: In Pandas 19.02, the indexing follows the same paradigms as Numpy. There’s not much of a difference if a newbie starts to slice pandas Dataframe according to the numpy conventions. However, there comes a time when things take turn for the worse when he/she encounters the three musketeers: iloc, loc and ix.
